meanings.definition: A typographical ornament or symbol used to decorate a page.
meanings.sent1: The book was filled with colorful dingbats to make it more interesting.
meanings.sent2: The designer added dingbats to the invitation for a festive touch.
meanings.sent3: The teacher joked that the dingbats were having a party on the page.
meanings.sent4: The dingbats danced across the paper, bringing life to the text.
meanings.sent5: The intricate dingbats made the document look like a work of art.

meanings.sent1: Don't listen to that dingbats; they always give silly advice.
meanings.sent2: The town had its fair share of dingbats who entertained everyone with their antics.
meanings.sent3: The dingbats in the comedy show had the audience laughing non-stop.
meanings.sent4: She felt like a dingbats in a world of serious individuals.
meanings.sent5: The old man was known as the village dingbats for his quirky behavior.
